kr.ac.kaist.mms_client

Class SecureMMSClientHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • kr.ac.kaist.mms_client.SecureMMSClientHandler

  • public class SecureMMSClientHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    It is an object that can communicate to MMS through HTTPS and send or receive messages of other objects.
    Version:
    0.5.7
    See Also:
    MMSClientHandler

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  SecureMMSClientHandler.PollingResponseCallback
      This interface is used to handle the response to polling request.
      static interface  SecureMMSClientHandler.RequestCallback
      This interface is used to handle the response to be sent when a message is received.
      static interface  SecureMMSClientHandler.ResponseCallback
      This interface is used to handle the response to be received when a message is sent.

    • Method Detail

      • startPolling

        public void startPolling(java.lang.String dstMRN,
                         java.lang.String svcMRN,
                         int interval,
                         SecureMMSClientHandler.PollingResponseCallback callback)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        This method is that client requests polling. If setting this method, send polling request per interval. In the MMS that received the polling request, if there is a message toward the client, the message is send to the MMS client, which requests polling, and in the MMS client, the callbackMethod is executed. Depending on whether it is the way of normal polling or long polling, the way of response is different.
        Parameters:
        dstMRN - the MRN of MMS to request polling
        svcMRN - the MRN of service, which may send to client
        interval - the frequency of polling (unit of time: ms)
        callback - the callback interface of SecureMMSClientHandler.PollingResponseCallback
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if exception occurs
        See Also:
        SecureMMSClientHandler.PollingResponseCallback

      • startGeoReporting

        public void startGeoReporting(java.lang.String svcMRN,
                              int interval)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • setServerPort

        public void setServerPort(int port,
                          java.lang.String jksDirectory,
                          java.lang.String jksPassword,
                          SecureMMSClientHandler.RequestCallback callback)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        This method configures client's port to act as a HTTPS server and create a rcvHandler object. HTTPS server is configured via jksDirectory and jksPassword which matches that. It is used in a network that supports push method. It receives all messages toward itself. When a message is received via the callback method, it is possible to handle the response to be sent.
        Parameters:
        port - port number
        jksDirectory - MMS certificate
        jksPassword - password of MMS certificate
        callback - callback interface of SecureMMSClientHandler.RequestCallback
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if exception occurs
        See Also:
        setServerPort(int, String, String, String, RequestCallback), addContext(String)

      • setServerPort

        public void setServerPort(int port,
                          java.lang.String context,
                          java.lang.String jksDirectory,
                          java.lang.String jksPassword,
                          SecureMMSClientHandler.RequestCallback callback)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        This method configures client's port to act as a HTTPS server and create a rcvHandler object. HTTPS server is configured via jksDirectory and jksPassword which matches that. It is used in a network that supports push method. This method configures default context and it receives messages that url matches the default context. When a message is received via the callback method, it is possible to handle the response to be sent.
        Parameters:
        port - port number
        context - context (e.g. /get/messages/)
        jksDirectory - MMS certificate
        jksPassword - password of MMS certificate
        callback - callback interface of SecureMMSClientHandler.RequestCallback
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if exception occurs
        See Also:
        setServerPort(int,, String, String, RequestCallback), addContext(String)

      • setFileServerPort

        public void setFileServerPort(int port,
                              java.lang.String fileDirectory,
                              java.lang.String fileName,
                              java.lang.String jksDirectory,
                              java.lang.String jksPassword,
                              SecureMMSClientHandler.RequestCallback callback)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        This method configures client's port to act as a HTTPS file server and create a rcvHandler object. HTTPS server is configured via jksDirectory and jksPassword which matches that. It is used in a network that supports push method. This method configures default context and it receives messages that url matches the default context. When a message is received via the callback method, it is possible to handle the response to be sent.
        Parameters:
        port - the port number
        fileDirectory - the file path (e.g. /files/ocean/waves/)
        fileName - the file name (e.g. mokpo.xml)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if exception occurs
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        addFileContext(String, String)

        Parameters:

                           java.lang.String fileName)
        Add file directory and file name to client's HTTPS file server
        Parameters:

        fileName - the file name (e.g. mokpo.xml)
        See Also:

      • setSender

        public void setSender(SecureMMSClientHandler.ResponseCallback callback)
        This method is used to set in MMS client in order to send message. If using this method, it is possible to use sendPostMsg and sendGetMsg method. When the client send a message, it can handle the response to be received via callback interface.
        Parameters:
        callback - the callback interface of SecureMMSClientHandler.ResponseCallback
        See Also:
        sendGetMsg(String), sendGetMsg(String, String, String), sendPostMsg(String, String), sendPostMsg(String, String, String), SecureMMSClientHandler.ResponseCallback

        Parameters:

      • requestFile

        public java.lang.String requestFile(java.lang.String dstMRN,
                                    java.lang.String fileName)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Use when requesting a file from the destination. Send a GET message to a file server mapping to destination MRN to request a file that matches the parameterized filename.
        Parameters:
        dstMRN - the destination MRN to send a message
        fileName - file path and name (e.g. "/get/test.xml")
        Returns:
        returning result of saving file null if saving file is failed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
